name: Acrobat

other.text: The Acrobat chooses a player. If the chosen player is drunk or poisoned, place the **DEAD** reminder. (*)

name: Alchemist
text:
You have a Minion ability. 
When using this, 
the Storyteller may prompt you to choose differently.

first.text:
Show the **YOU ARE** info token then the character token of a not-in-play Minion. Put the Alchemist to sleep.
Mark the Alchemist with the **IS THE ALCHEMIST** token. (*) Swap the Alchemist token with this Minion token.
Turn the Minion token upside-down. (This shows they are still good.).

name: Al-Hadikhia
text:
Each night*, you may choose 3 players (all players learn who): 
each silently chooses to live or die, 
but if all live, all die.

other.text:
The Al-Hadikhia points at three players:
    Mark these players with the **1**, **2**, & **3** reminders, in the chosen order. Put the Al-Hadikhia to sleep. 
    Wake the player marked **1** & say "The A-l Hadikhia has chosen" then the name of the player.
    Ask "Do you choose to live?" They nod or shake their head. Put them to sleep. Repeat for players marked **2** & **3**.
    Remove a shroud (if any) for players that choose live, & add a shroud for players that choose die.
    If all three are alive (none have a shroud), add a shroud to all three.

name: Alsaahir
text:
Once per day, if you publicly guess 
which players are Minion(s) and which are Demon(s), 
good wins.

jinxes.text: If the Vizier is in play, the Alsaahir must also guess which Demon(s) are in play.

name: Amnesiac
text:
You do not know what your ability is. 
Each day, privately guess what it is: 
you learn how accurate you are.

first.text:
This ability should occur at the appropriate time in the night order. Abilities are usually ordered: 
    Poisoners, Protectors, Killers, Information

other.text:
This ability should occur at the appropriate time in the night order. Abilities are usually ordered: 
    Poisoners, Protectors, Killers, Information

name: Angel
text: Something bad might happen to whoever is most responsible for the death of a new player.

name: Apprentice
text: On your 1st night, you gain a Townsfolk ability (if good) or a Minion ability (if evil).

name: Artist
text:
Once per game, during the day, 
privately ask the Storyteller any yes/no question.

name: Assassin
text:
Once per game, at night*, choose a player: 
they die, even if for some reason they could not.

other.text: The Assassin might choose a player. (*)(*)

name: Atheist
text:
The Storyteller can break the game rules, 
and if executed, good wins, even if you are dead. 
[No evil characters]

name: Balloonist
text:
Each night, you learn a player 
of a different character type than last night. 
[+0 or +1 Outsider]

first.text:
Point to a player (alive or dead).
Place the SEEN token next to the shown player. (*)

other.text:
Point to a player (alive or dead) with a different role type from the player with the SEEN token.
Place the SEEN token next to the shown player. (*)

name: Banshee
text:
If the Demon kills you, all players learn this. 
From now on, you may nominate twice per day 
and vote twice per nomination.

other.text:
If the demon killed the Banshee tonight, place the **HAS ABILITY** token. (*)
    Publicly announce that the Banshee died.

name: Barber
text:
If you died today or tonight, the Demon may choose 
2 players (not another Demon) to swap characters.

other.text:
If the Barber died today or tonight, show the Demon the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** & Barber tokens.
If the Demon chose 2 players, wake one at a time. Show the **YOU ARE** token & their new character token.

name: Barista
text: Each night, until dusk, 1) a player becomes sober, healthy & gets true info, or 2) their ability works twice. They learn which.

name: Baron
text:
There are extra Outsiders in play. 
[+2 Outsiders]

name: Beggar
text: You must use a vote token to vote. If a dead player gives you theirs, you learn their alignment. You are sober and healthy.

name: Bishop
text: Only the Storyteller can nominate. At least 1 opposing player must be nominated each day.

name: Boffin
text:
The Demon (even if drunk or poisoned) 
has a not-in-play good character's ability. 
You both know which.

jinxes.text: If the Demon has the Cult Leader ability, they can't turn good due to this ability.
If the Alchemist has the Boffin ability, the Alchemist does not learn what ability the Demon has.
If the Demon has the Goon ability, they can't turn good due to this ability.
If there is a spare token, the Boffin can give the Demon the Village Idiot ability.
If the Demon would have the Drunk ability, the Boffin chooses a Townsfolk player to have this ability instead.
The Demon cannot have the Politician ability.
The Demon cannot have the Ogre ability.

first.text:
Wake the Boffin and the Demon. 
    Show the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** info token, then the Boffin token, then the good character token. 
    Place this second character token by the Demon character token.

name: Bone Collector
text: Once per game, at night, choose a dead player: they regain their ability until dusk.

name: Boomdandy
text:
If you are executed, all but 3 players die. 
After a 10 to 1 countdown, 
the player with the most players pointing at them, dies.

name: Bootlegger
text: This script has homebrew characters or rules.

name: Bounty Hunter
text:
You start knowing 1 evil player. 
If the player you know dies, you learn another 
evil player tonight. [1 Townsfolk is evil]

jinxes.text: An evil Townsfolk is only created if the Bounty Hunter is still in play after the Kazali acts.
If the Philosopher gains the Bounty Hunter ability, a Townsfolk might turn evil.

first.text:
Wake any player with a Townsfolk character:
    Show them the **YOU ARE** token, & a thumbs down. Put them back to sleep. 
    Turn their token upside-down. (This shows they are evil.)
Wake the Bounty Hunter, point to an evil player. Place the **SEEN** token beside the shown player. (*)

other.text:
If the player with the **SEEN** token died today or tonight, point to an evil player. 
Move the **SEEN** token to the shown player. (*)

name: Buddhist
text: For the first 2 minutes of each day, veteran players may not talk.

name: Bureaucrat
text: Each night, choose a player (not yourself): their vote counts as 3 votes tomorrow.

name: Butcher
text: Each day, after the 1st execution, you may nominate again.

name: Butler
text:
Each night, choose a player (not yourself): 
tomorrow, you may only vote if they are voting too.

jinxes.text: If the Organ Grinder is causing eyes closed voting, the Butler may raise their hand to vote but their vote is only counted if their master voted too.

first.text: The Butler chooses a player. (*)

other.text: The Butler chooses a player. (*)

name: Cannibal
text:
You have the ability of the recently killed executee. 
If they are evil, you are poisoned 
until a good player dies by execution.

jinxes.text: If the Cannibal gains the Butler ability, the Cannibal learns this.
If the Juggler guesses on their first day and dies by execution, tonight the living Cannibal learns how many guesses the Juggler got correct.
If the Cannibal eats the Poppy Grower, then dies or loses the Poppy Grower ability, the Demon and Minions learn each other that night.
If the Cannibal gains the Zealot ability, the Cannibal learns this.

other.text:
The Cannibal has the ability of the most recently executed player. 
They immediately learn any 'you start knowing' information.

name: Cerenovus
text:
Each night, choose a player & a good character: 
they are "mad" they are this character tomorrow, 
or might be executed.

jinxes.text: The Cerenovus may choose to make a player mad that they are the Goblin.

first.text:
The Cerenovus chooses a player & a character. (*) Put the Cerenovus to sleep. Wake the target.
Show the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** token, the Cerenovus token, then the madness-character token.

other.text:
The Cerenovus chooses a player & a character. (*) Put the Cerenovus to sleep. Wake the target.
Show the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** token, the Cerenovus token, then the madness-character token.

name: Chambermaid
text:
Each night, choose 2 alive players (not yourself): 
you learn how many woke tonight due to their 
ability.

first.text: The Chambermaid chooses 2 living players. Give a finger signal.

other.text: The Chambermaid chooses 2 living players. Give a finger signal.

name: Chef
text:
You start knowing how many pairs 
of evil players there are.

first.text: Give a finger signal.

name: Choirboy
text:
If the Demon kills the King, 
you learn which player is the Demon. 
[+ the King]

other.text: If the Demon killed the King, wake the Choirboy. Point to the Demon player.

name: Clockmaker
text:
You start knowing how many steps 
from the Demon to its nearest Minion.

first.text: Give a finger signal.

name: Courtier
text:
Once per game, at night, choose a character: 
they are drunk for 3 nights & 3 days.

first.text: The Courtier might choose a character. (*)(*)

other.text: The Courtier might choose a character. (*)(*)

name: Cult Leader
text:
Each night, you become the alignment of an alive neighbor. 
If all good players choose to join your cult, your team wins.

first.text:
The Cult Leader becomes the alignment of one of their living neighbors. If their alignment changed: 
    Wake the Cult Leader, show them the **YOU ARE** token, &either a thumbs down (if evil) or thumbs up (if good). 
    Put the Cult Leader back to sleep.
    Turn the Cult Leader token upside-down. (This shows their alignment.)

other.text:
The Cult Leader becomes the alignment of one of their living neighbors. If their alignment changed: 
    Wake the Cult Leader, show them the **YOU ARE** token, &either a thumbs down (if evil) or thumbs up (if good). 
    Put the Cult Leader back to sleep.
    Turn the Cult Leader token upside-down. (This shows their alignment.)

name: Damsel
text:
All Minions know you are in play. 
If a Minion publicly guesses you (once), 
your team loses.

first.text: Wake each Minion. Show the Damsel token.

name: Deviant
text: If you were funny today, you cannot die by exile.

name: Devil's Advocate
text:
Each night, choose a living player 
(different to last night): 
if executed tomorrow, they don't die.

first.text: The Devil's Advocate chooses a living player. (*)

other.text: The Devil's Advocate chooses a living player. (*)

name: Djinn
text: Use the Djinn's special rule. All players know what it is.

name: Doomsayer
text: If 4 or more players live, each living player may publicly choose (once per game) that a player of their own alignment dies.

name: Dreamer
text:
Each night, choose a player (not yourself or Travellers): 
you learn 1 good and 1 evil character, 
1 of which is correct.

first.text: The Dreamer points to a player. Show 1 good & 1 evil character token, 1 of which is their character.

other.text: The Dreamer points to a player. Show 1 good & 1 evil character token, 1 of which is their character.

name: Drunk
text:
You do not know you are the Drunk. 
You think you are a Townsfolk character, 
but you are not.

name: Duchess
text: Each day, 3 players may choose to visit you. At night*, each visitor learns how many visitors are evil, but 1 gets false info.

name: Empath
text:
Each night, you learn how many 
of your 2 alive neighbours are evil.

first.text: Give a finger signal.

other.text: Give a finger signal.

name: Engineer
text:
Once per game, at night, 
choose which Minions or which Demon is in play.

first.text:
If the Engineer points to a Demon or Minions on their character sheet:
    Swap all appropriate character tokens with new character tokens.
    Wake each evil player that changed character, show the **YOU ARE** info token, then their new character token. Put them to sleep. 
    Mark the Engineer with the **NO ABILITY** reminder token. (*)

other.text:
If the Engineer points to a Demon or Minions on their character sheet:
    Swap all appropriate character tokens with new character tokens.
    Wake each evil player that changed character, show the **YOU ARE** info token, then their new character token. Put them to sleep. 
    Mark the Engineer with the **NO ABILITY** reminder token. (*)

name: Evil Twin
text:
You & an opposing player know each other. 
If the good player is executed, evil wins. 
Good can't win if you both live.

first.text:
Wake both twins. Allow eye contact.
Show the good twin's character token to the Evil Twin &vice versa.

name: Exorcist
text:
Each night*, choose a player (different to last night): 
the Demon, if chosen, learns who you are 
then doesn't wake tonight.

other.text:
The Exorcist chooses a player. (*) Put the Exorcist to sleep. If the Exorcist chose the Demon:
    Wake the Demon. Show the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED** YOU & Exorcist tokens. Point to the Exorcist.

name: Fang Gu
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
The 1st Outsider this kills becomes an evil Fang Gu 
& you die instead. [+1 Outsider]

jinxes.text: If the Fang Gu chooses an Outsider and dies, the Scarlet Woman does not become the Fang Gu.

other.text:
The Fang Gu chooses a player. (*) If they chose an Outsider (once only):
    Replace the Outsider token with the spare Fang Gu token. Put the Fang Gu to sleep. Wake the target. 
    Show the **YOU ARE** and Fang Gu tokens & give a thumbs-down. (*)

name: Farmer
text:
If you die at night, 
an alive good player becomes a Farmer.

other.text:
If the Farmer died tonight: 
    Wake an alive good player.
    Show them the **YOU ARE** info token and a Farmer character token, then put them to sleep. 
    Replace their previous character token with a Farmer character token.

name: Fearmonger
text:
Each night, choose a player: 
if you nominate & execute them, their team loses. 
All players know if you choose a new player.

first.text:
The Fearmonger picks a player:
    Mark the chosen player with the **FEAR** reminder. (*) Declare that "The Fearmonger has chosen a player."

other.text:
The Fearmonger picks a player. If they chose a player who wasn't already marked with the **FEAR** reminder:
    Mark the chosen player with the **FEAR** reminder. (*) Declare that "The Fearmonger has chosen a player."

name: Ferryman
text: On the final day, all dead players regain their vote token.

name: Fibbin
text: Once per game, 1 good player might get incorrect information.

name: Fiddler
text: Once per game, the Demon secretly chooses an opposing player: all players choose which of these 2 players win.

name: Fisherman
text:
Once per game, during the day, 
visit the Storyteller for some advice 
to help your team win.

name: Flowergirl
text:
Each night*, you learn 
if a Demon voted today.

name: Fool
text:
The first time you die, 
you don't.

name: Fortune Teller
text:
Each night, choose 2 players: 
you learn if either is a Demon. 
There is a good player that registers as a Demon to you.

first.text: The Fortune Teller chooses 2 players. Nod if either is the Demon (or the **RED HERRING**).

other.text: The Fortune Teller chooses 2 players. Nod if either is the Demon (or the **RED HERRING**).

name: Gambler
text:
Each night*, choose a player & guess their character: 
if you guess wrong, you die.

other.text: The Gambler chooses a player & a character. (*)

name: Gangster
text: Once per day, you may choose to kill an alive neighbor, if your other alive neighbor agrees.

name: Gardener
text: The Storyteller assigns 1 or more players' characters.

name: General
text:
Each night, you learn which alignment 
the Storyteller believes is winning: 
good, evil, or neither.

first.text:
If you believe that the good team is winning, give a thumbs up.
If you believe that the evil team is winning, give a thumbs down.
If you don't know which team is winning, give a thumbs to the side.

other.text:
If you believe that the good team is winning, give a thumbs up.
If you believe that the evil team is winning, give a thumbs down.
If you don't know which team is winning, give a thumbs to the side.

name: Gnome
text: All players start knowing a player of your alignment. You may choose to kill anyone who nominates them.

name: Goblin
text:
If you publicly claim to be the Goblin 
when nominated & are executed that day, 
your team wins.

name: Godfather
text:
You start knowing which Outsiders are in play. 
If 1 died today, choose a player tonight: they die. 
[-1 or +1 Outsider]

jinxes.text: Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.

first.text: Show the character tokens of al in-play Outsiders.

other.text: If an Outsider died today, the Godfather chooses a player. (*)

name: Golem
text:
You may only nominate once per game. 
When you do, if the nominee is not the Demon, 
they die.

name: Goon
text:
Each night, the 1st player to choose you 
with their ability is drunk until dusk. 
You become their alignment.

name: Gossip
text:
Each day, you may make a public statement. 
Tonight, if it was true, a player dies.

name: Grandmother
text:
You start knowing a good player & their character. 
If the Demon kills them, you die too.

first.text: Point to the grandchild player & show their character token.

other.text: If the grandchild was killed by the Demon, the Grandmother dies too. (*)

name: Gunslinger
text: Each day, after the 1st vote has been tallied, you may choose a player that voted: they die.

name: Harlot
text: Each night*, choose a living player: if they agree, you learn their character, but you both might die.

name: Harpy
text:
Each night, choose 2 players: 
tomorrow, the 1st player is mad that the 2nd is evil, 
or one or both might die.

first.text:
The Harpy chooses a player (*) & then another player. (*) Put the Harpy to sleep. Wake the first target.
Show the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** token, the Harpy token, then point to the second target.

other.text:
The Harpy chooses a player (*) & then another player. (*) Put the Harpy to sleep. Wake the first target.
Show the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** token, the Harpy token, then point to the second target.

name: Hatter
text:
If you died today or tonight, 
the Minion & Demon players 
may choose new Minion & Demon characters to be.

other.text:
If the Hatter died, wake the Minions and Demon:
    Show them the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** info token, then the Hatter token. 
    Each player may point to another character of the same type as their current character. 
    If a second player would end up with the same character as another player:
        Shake your head no and gesture for them to choose again. 
    Put them to sleep. Remove the **TEA PARTY TONIGHT** reminder. 
    Change each player to the character they chose.

name: Hell's Librarian
text: Something bad might happen to whoever talks when the Storyteller has asked for silence.

name: Heretic
text:
Whoever wins, loses & whoever loses, wins, 
even if you are dead.

jinxes.text: Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
The Baron might only add 1 Outsider, not 2.
Only 1 jinxed character can be in play.
The Demon cannot have the Heretic ability.
If the Lleech has poisoned the Heretic then the Lleech dies, the Heretic remains poisoned.
A Pit-Hag can not create a Heretic.

name: High Priestess
text:
Each night, learn which player 
the Storyteller believes you should talk to most.

first.text: Point to the player whom you most think the High Priestess should speak with tomorrow.

other.text: Point to the player whom you most think the High Priestess should speak with tomorrow.

name: Huntsman
text:
Once per game, at night, choose a living player: 
the Damsel, if chosen, becomes a not-in-play Townsfolk. 
[+the Damsel]

first.text:
If the Huntsman points to a player:
    Put them to sleep. Mark them with the **NO ABILITY** token. (*)
    If they chose the Damsel, wake the Damsel, show the **NO ABILITY** info token, then a not-in-play Townsfolk token. 
    Put the Damsel to sleep. Replace the Damsel character token with their new Townsfolk character token.

other.text:
If the Huntsman points to a player:
    Put them to sleep. Mark them with the **NO ABILITY** token. (*)
    If they chose the Damsel, wake the Damsel, show the **NO ABILITY** info token, then a not-in-play Townsfolk token. 
    Put the Damsel to sleep. Replace the Damsel character token with their new Townsfolk character token.

name: Imp
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
If you kill yourself this way, 
a Minion becomes the Imp.

other.text:
The Imp chooses a player. (*) If the Imp chose themselves: 
    Replace 1 alive Minion token with a spare Imp token. 
    Put the old Imp to sleep. Wake the new Imp.
    Show the **YOU ARE** token, then show the Imp token.

name: Innkeeper
text:
Each night*, choose 2 players: 
they can't die tonight, but 1 is drunk until dusk.

other.text: The Innkeeper chooses 2 players. (*)(*)(*)

name: Investigator
text:
You start knowing that 1 of 2 players 
is a particular Minion.

first.text: Show the Minion character token. Point to both the **MINION** and **WRONG** players.

name: Judge
text: Once per game, if another player nominated, you may choose to force the current execution to pass or fail.

name: Juggler
text:
On your 1st day, 
publicly guess up to 5 players' characters. 
That night, you learn how many you got correct.

other.text: Give a finger signal.

name: Kazali
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
[You choose which players are which Minions. 
-? to +? Outsiders]

jinxes.text: The Kazali can choose that the Goon player is one of their evil Minions.
If the Kazali chooses to create a Marionette, they must choose one of their neighbors.
If the Kazali chooses the Damsel to become a Minion, and a Huntsman is in play, a good player becomes the Damsel.
The Kazali can not choose the King to become a Minion if a Choirboy is in play.
The Kazali can choose that the Soldier player is one of their evil Minions.

first.text:
The Kazali points at a player and a Minion on the character sheet.
    Replace their old character token with the Minion token. Wake the player.
    Show them the **You Are** info token then the Minion character token, and give a thumbs down. 
    Repeat until the normal number of Minions exist. 
    Put the Kazali to sleep.
Remove all Minion tokens and add Townsfolk or Outsider tokens.

other.text: The Kazali chooses a player. (*)

name: King
text:
Each night, if the dead equal or outnumber the living, 
you learn 1 alive character. 
The Demon knows you are the King.

first.text: Wake the Demon. Show them the **THIS PLAYER IS** info token, then the King token, then point at the King player.

other.text:
If the number of dead players is equal to or exceeds the number of alive players:
    Wake the King. Show one alive character token. Put the King to sleep.

name: Klutz
text:
When you learn that you died, publicly choose 
1 alive player: if they are evil, your team loses.

name: Knight
text:
You start knowing 2 players 
that are not the Demon.

first.text: Point to the two players marked **KNOW**. (*)(*)

name: Legion
text:
Each night*, a player might die. 
Executions fail if only evil voted. 
You register as a Minion too. [Most players are Legion]

jinxes.text: Legion and the Engineer can not both be in play at the start of the game. If the Engineer creates Legion, most players (including all evil players) become evil Legion.
The Zealot might register as evil to Legion's ability.
If Legion died by execution today, Legion keeps their ability, but the Minstrel might learn they are Legion.
If the Preacher chooses Legion, Legion keeps their ability, but the Preacher might learn they are Legion.
If the Hatter dies and Legion is in play, nothing happens. If the Hatter dies and an evil player chooses Legion, all current evil players become Legion.

other.text: You may decide a player that dies. (Once per living Legion) (*)

name: Leviathan
text:
If more than 1 good player is executed, evil wins. 
All players know you are in play. 
After day 5, evil wins.

jinxes.text: If Leviathan is in play and the Grandchild dies by execution, evil wins.
If the Leviathan is in play, the Monk-protected-player is safe from all evil abilities.
Evil does not win when more than 1 good player has been executed, if the Exorcist is alive and has ever successfully chosen the Leviathan.
If the Leviathan is in play, the Innkeeper-protected-players are safe from all evil abilities.
Each night*, the Leviathan chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Farmer uses their ability but does not die.
Each night*, the Leviathan chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Sage uses their ability but does not die.
If the Leviathan is in play & no execution occurs on day 5, good wins.
If the Leviathan is in play, and at least 1 player is dead, the King learns an alive character each night.
If the Leviathan is in play, the Soldier is safe from all evil abilities.
If the Hatter dies on or after day 5, the Demon cannot choose Leviathan.
Each night*, the Leviathan chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Banshee dies & gains their ability.
Each night*, the Leviathan chooses an alive player (different to previous nights): a chosen Ravenkeeper uses their ability but does not die.
After day 5, the Pit-Hag cannot choose Leviathan.

first.text: Mark the Leviathan with the **DAY 1** reminder. (*)

other.text: Mark the Leviathan with either the **DAY 2**, **DAY 3**, **DAY 4**, or **DAY 5** reminder. (*)

name: Librarian
text:
You start knowing that 1 of 2 players 
is a particular Outsider. (Or that zero are in play.)

first.text: Show the Outsider character token. Point to both the **OUTSIDER** and **WRONG** players.

name: Lil' Monsta
text:
Each night, Minions choose 
who babysits Lil' Monsta & 'is the Demon'. 
Each night*, a player might die. [+1 Minion]

jinxes.text: Each night, the Magician chooses a Minion: if that Minion & Lil' Monsta are alive, that Minion babysits Lil’ Monsta.
If the Poppy Grower is in play, Minions don't wake together. They are woken one by one, until one of them chooses to take the Lil' Monsta token.
If a Demon chooses Lil' Monsta, they also choose a Minion to become and babysit Lil' Monsta tonight.
The Vizier can die by execution if they are babysitting Lil' Monsta.
If there are 5 or more players alive and the player holding the Lil' Monsta token dies, the Scarlet Woman is given the Lil' Monsta token tonight.

first.text:
Instead of the normal Minion Info and Demon Info steps, do the following:
    Wake all Minions. Show the **THESE ARE YOUR MINIONS** token. The minions pick a player:
        Put the minions back to sleep. Wake the chosen player. Point to the player, & show them the **IS THE DEMON** token. 
        Put the chosen player back to sleep. Place the **IS THE DEMON** token beside them. (*)

other.text:
The minions pick a player. Put them back to sleep, and then:
    Wake the chosen player. Point to the player, & show them the **IS THE DEMON** token. 
    Put the chosen player back to sleep. Place the **IS THE DEMON** token beside them. (*)
Place the **DEAD** token beside any living player. (*)

name: Lleech
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
You start by choosing a player: they are poisoned. 
You die if & only if they are dead.

jinxes.text: If the Mastermind is alive and the Lleech's host dies by execution, the Lleech lives but loses their ability.
If the Slayer slays the Lleech's host, the host dies.

first.text: The Lleech picks a player. Mark them with the **POISONED** token. (*)

other.text: The Lleech chooses a player. Mark them with the **DEAD** token. (*)

name: Lord Of Typhon
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
[Evil characters are in a line. You are in the middle. 
+1 Minion. -? to +? Outsiders]

jinxes.text: If the Summoner creates a Lord of Typhon, the Lord of Typhon must neighbor a Minion. The other neighbor becomes a not-in-play evil Minion.

first.text: Remove all Minion tokens and add Townsfolk or Outsider tokens.

Wake the appropriate number of players directly clockwise and counter-clockwise from the Lord of Typhon:
    Show each of these players a unique Minion token, and give a thumbs down.
    Replace these players’ good character tokens with these Minion tokens and put these players to sleep.
    Then, do the Minion Info and Demon Info steps as normal.

other.text: The Lord of Typhon chooses a player. (*)

name: Lunatic
text:
You think you are a Demon, but you are not. 
The Demon knows who you are 
& who you choose at night.

first.text:
If there are 7 or more players, wake the Lunatic:
    Show the **THESE ARE YOUR MINIONS** token. Point to any players.
    Show the **THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY** token. Show 3 good character tokens. 
    Put the Lunatic to sleep. Wake the Demon.
    Show the **YOU ARE** info token and the Demon token.
    Show the **THIS PLAYER IS** info token and the Lunatic token, then point to the Lunatic.

other.text:
Do whatever needs to be done to simulate the Demon acting. 
Put the Lunatic to sleep. Wake the Demon.
Show the Lunatic token &point to them, then their target(s).

name: Lycanthrope
text:
Each night*, choose an alive player. 
If good, they die & the Demon doesn’t kill tonight. 
One good player registers as evil.

jinxes.text: If the Lycanthrope is alive and the Gambler kills themself at night, no other players can die tonight.

other.text:
The Lycanthrope points to a player. If the chosen player is good:
    Mark them with the **DEAD** reminder. (*) Demon doesn’t kill tonight.

name: Magician
text:
The Demon thinks you are a Minion. 
Minions think you are a Demon.

first.text:
If there are 7 or more players, instead of the normal Minion Info and Demon Info steps, do the following:
    Wake all Minions. Show the **THIS IS THE DEMON** token. Point to the Demon & the Magician.
    Put the Minions to sleep. Wake the Demon.
    Show the **THESE ARE YOUR MINIONS** token. Point to al Minions &the Magician.
    Show the **THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY** token. Show 3 not-in-play good character tokens.

name: Marionette
text:
You think you are a good character but you are not. 
The Demon knows who you are. 
[You neighbor the Demon]

jinxes.text: If the Marionette thinks that they are the Balloonist, +1 Outsider might have been added.
When the Poppy Grower dies, the Demon learns the Marionette but the Marionette learns nothing.
If the Marionette thinks that they are the Huntsman, the Damsel was added.
The Marionette does not learn 3 not in-play characters. The Demon learns an extra 3 instead.
The Marionette neighbors a Minion, not the Demon. The Marionette is not woken to choose who takes the Lil' Monsta token, and does not learn they are the Marionette if they have the Lil' Monsta token.
The Marionette does not learn that a Damsel is in play.

first.text:
Wake the Demon. Point to the player marked **IS THE MARIONETTE** & show the Marionette character token. 
Put the Demon to sleep.

name: Mastermind
text:
If the Demon dies by execution (ending the game), 
play for 1 more day. 
If a player is then executed, their team loses.

jinxes.text: If the Al-Hadikhia dies by execution, and the Mastermind is alive, the Al-Hadikhia chooses 3 good players tonight: if all 3 choose to live, evil wins. Otherwise, good wins.

name: Mathematician
text:
Each night, you learn 
how many players' abilities worked abnormally 
(since dawn) due to another character's ability.

jinxes.text: The Chambermaid learns if the Mathematician wakes tonight or not, even though the Chambermaid wakes first.
The Mathematician learns if the Lunatic attacks a different player(s) than the real Demon attacked.

first.text: Give a finger signal.

other.text: Give a finger signal.

name: Matron
text: Each day, you may choose up to 3 sets of 2 players to swap seats. Players may not leave their seats to talk in private.

name: Mayor
text:
If only 3 players live & no execution occurs, 
your team wins. 
If you die at night, another player might die instead.

name: Mezepheles
text:
You start knowing a secret word. 
The 1st good player to say this word 
becomes evil that night.

first.text: Show a single word on a piece of paper, phone, or other device.

other.text:
If a player is marked with the **TURNS EVIL** reminder:
    Wake them. Show the **YOU ARE** info token then give a thumbs down. Put them to sleep.
    Turn their character token upside down. (This shows they are now evil.) 
    Mark the Mezepheles with the **NO ABILITY** reminder. (*)

name: Minstrel
text:
When a Minion dies by execution, all other players 
(except Travellers) are drunk until dusk tomorrow.

name: Monk
text:
Each night*, choose a player (not yourself): 
they are safe from the Demon tonight.

other.text: The Monk chooses a player. (*)

name: Moonchild
text:
When you learn that you died, 
publicly choose 1 alive player. 
Tonight, if it was a good player, they die.

other.text: If the Moonchild is due to kill a good player, they die. (*)

name: Mutant
text:
If you are "mad" about being an Outsider, 
you might be executed.

name: Nightwatchman
text:
Once per game, at night, choose a player: 
they learn you are the Nightwatchman.

first.text:
If the Nightwatchman points at a player:
    Put the Nightwatchman to sleep.
    Wake the chosen player, show them the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** info token & the Nightwatchman token. 
    Point to the Nightwatchman player. Put the chosen player back to sleep.
    Mark the Nightwatchman with the **NO ABILITY** reminder token. (*)

other.text:
If the Nightwatchman points at a player:
    Put the Nightwatchman to sleep.
    Wake the chosen player, show them the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** info token & the Nightwatchman token. 
    Point to the Nightwatchman player. Put the chosen player back to sleep.
    Mark the Nightwatchman with the **NO ABILITY** reminder token. (*)

name: Noble
text:
You start knowing 3 players, 
1 and only 1 of which is evil.

first.text: Point to al three players marked **KNOW**.

name: No Dashii
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
Your 2 Townsfolk neighbours are poisoned.

other.text: The No Dashii chooses a player. (*)

name: Ogre
text:
On your 1st night, choose a player (not yourself): 
you become their alignment (you don’t know which) 
even if drunk or poisoned.

jinxes.text: If the Recluse registers as evil to the Ogre, the Ogre learns that they are evil.

first.text:
The Ogre points to a player:
    If the player is evil, flip the Ogre's token upside down.

name: Ojo
text:
Each night*, choose a character: they die. 
If they are not in play, 
the Storyteller chooses who dies.

other.text:
The Ojo points to a role. If a player has that role, they die. (*)
If the role is out of play, the Storyteller chooses any number of players that die. (*)

name: Oracle
text:
Each night*, you learn 
how many dead players are evil.

other.text: Give a finger signal.

name: Organ Grinder
text:
All players keep their eyes closed when voting 
and the vote tally is secret. 
Each night, choose if you are drunk until dusk.

first.text:
The Organ Grinder either nods or shakes their head: 
    If they nod their head, mark them with the **DRUNK** reminder. (*) 
   If they shake their head, remove their **DRUNK** reminder.

other.text:
The Organ Grinder either nods or shakes their head: 
    If they nod their head, mark them with the **DRUNK** reminder. (*) 
   If they shake their head, remove their **DRUNK** reminder.

name: Pacifist
text:
Executed good players 
might not die.

name: Philosopher
text:
Once per game, at night, 
choose a good character: gain that ability. 
If this character is in play, they are drunk.

first.text: The Philosopher might choose a character. If necessary, swap their character token. (*)

other.text: The Philosopher might choose a character. If necessary, swap their character token. (*)

name: Pit-Hag
text:
Each night*, choose a player 
& a character they become (if not-in-play). 
If a Demon is made, deaths tonight are arbitrary.

jinxes.text: If the Pit-Hag turns an evil player into the Cult Leader, they can't turn good due to their own ability.
If the Pit-Hag turns an evil player into the Goon, they can't turn good due to their own ability.
If there is a spare token, the Pit-Hag can create an extra Village Idiot. If so, the drunk Village Idiot might change.
If the Pit-Hag turns an evil player into the Politician, they can't turn good due to their own ability.
If a Pit-Hag creates a Damsel, the Storyteller chooses which player it is.
If the Pit-Hag turns an evil player into the Ogre, they can't turn good due to their own ability.

other.text:
The Pit-Hag chooses a player & a character. If they chose a character that is not in play:
    Put the Pit-Hag to sleep. Wake the target. Show the **YOU ARE** token & their new character token.

name: Pixie
text:
You start knowing 1 in-play Townsfolk. 
If you were mad that you were this character, 
you gain their ability when they die.

first.text: Show the Townsfolk character token marked **MAD**.

other.text:
If the Townsfolk marked **MAD** died, & the Pixie player has been sufficiently mad that they were this character:
     Replace the **MAD** reminder with the **HAS ABILITY** reminder. (*)

name: Plague Doctor
text:
If you die, 
the Storyteller gains a Minion ability.

jinxes.text: If the Plague Doctor dies, a living Minion gains the Goblin ability in addition to their own ability, and learns this.

If the Demon has a neighbor who is alive and a Townsfolk or Outsider when the Plague Doctor dies, that player becomes an evil Marionette. If there is already an extra evil player, this does not happen.
The Storyteller cannot gain the Evil Twin ability if the Plague Doctor dies.
If the Plague Doctor dies, a living Minion gains the Fearmonger ability in addition to their own ability, and learns this.
If the Storyteller gains the Baron ability, up to two players become not-in-play Outsiders.
If the Plague Doctor dies, a living Minion gains the Scarlet Woman ability in addition to their own ability, and learns this.
If the Plague Doctor dies, a living Minion gains the Spy ability in addition to their own ability, and learns this.
If the Plague Doctor is executed and the Storyteller would gain the Boomdandy ability, the Boomdandy ability triggers immediately.

other.text:
If the Plague Doctor died, place a Minion character token in the center of the Grimoire. 
    Mark this with the **STORYTELLER ABILITY** reminder. If applicable, add a token to the night sheet.

name: Po
text:
Each night*, you may choose a player: they die. 
If your last choice was no-one, 
choose 3 players tonight.

other.text: The Po may choose a player OR chooses 3 players fi they chose no-one last night. (*) or (*)(*)(*

name: Poisoner
text:
Each night, choose a player: 
they are poisoned tonight and tomorrow day.

first.text: The Poisoner chooses a player. (*)

other.text: The Poisoner chooses a player. (*)

name: Politician
text:
If you were the player most responsible for your team losing, 
you change alignment & win, 
even if dead.

name: Poppy Grower
text:
Minions & Demons do not know each other. 
If you die, they learn who each other are that night.

first.text:
Wake the Demon.
Show the **THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY** token. Show 3 not-in-play good character tokens. Put the Demon to sleep. Do not do the Minion Info and Demon Info steps.

other.text:
If the Poppy Grower died today or tonight, & is marked with the **EVIL WAKES** reminder:
    Show the **THIS IS THE DEMON** info token, then point to the Demon. Put the Minions to sleep.
    Wake the Demon. Show the **THESE ARE YOUR MINIONS** info token, then point to the Minions. Put the Demon to sleep.

name: Preacher
text:
Each night, choose a player: 
a Minion, if chosen, learns this. 
All chosen Minions have no ability.

first.text:
The Preacher chooses a player. If they choose a Minion:
    Put a **PREACHED** reminder token next to that Minion. Wake the chosen Minion.
    Show them the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** card & the Preacher token. Put the Minion back to sleep.

other.text:
The Preacher chooses a player. If they choose a Minion:
    Put a **PREACHED** reminder token next to that Minion. Wake the chosen Minion.
    Show them the **THIS CHARACTER SELECTED YOU** card & the Preacher token. Put the Minion back to sleep.

name: Professor
text:
Once per game, at night*, choose a dead player: 
if they are a Townsfolk, they are resurrected.

other.text: The Professor might choose a dead player. (*)(*)

name: Psychopath
text:
Each day, before nominations, 
you may publicly choose a player: they die. 
If executed, you only die if you lose roshambo.

name: Pukka
text:
Each night, choose a player: they are poisoned. 
The previously poisoned player dies then becomes 
healthy.

first.text: The Pukka chooses a player. (*)

other.text: The Pukka chooses a player. (*) The previously poisoned player dies then becomes healthy. (*)

name: Puzzlemaster
text:
1 player is drunk, even if you die. 
If you guess (once) who it is, learn the Demon player, 
but guess wrong & get false info.

name: Ravenkeeper
text:
If you die at night, 
you are woken to choose a player: 
you learn their character.

other.text: If the Ravenkeeper died tonight, the Ravenkeeper chooses a player. Show that player's character token.

name: Recluse
text:
You might register as evil & as a Minion or Demon, 
even if dead.

name: Revolutionary
text: 2 neighboring players are known to be the same alignment. Once per game, 1 of them registers falsely.

name: Riot
text:
On day 3, Minions become Riot 
& nominees die but nominate an alive player immediately. 
This must happen.

jinxes.text: If Riot is in play and the Grandchild dies during the day, the Grandmother dies too.
If Riot is in play, the Monk-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.
If the Exorcist chooses Riot on the 3rd night, Minions do not become Riot.
If Riot is in play, the Innkeeper-protected player is safe from all evil abilities.
Each night*, Riot chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Farmer uses their ability but does not die.
Each night*, Riot chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Sage uses their ability but does not die.
The Mayor may choose to stop nominations. If they do so when only 1 Riot is alive, good wins. Otherwise, evil wins.
If Riot is in play, and at least 1 player is dead, the King learns an alive character each night.
If Riot is in play, the Soldier is safe from all evil abilities.
Each night*, Riot chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Banshee dies & gains their ability.
Each night*, Riot chooses an alive good player (different to previous nights): a chosen Ravenkeeper uses their ability but does not die.

name: Sage
text:
If the Demon kills you, 
you learn that it is 1 of 2 players.

other.text: If the Demon killed the Sage, wake the Sage and point to 2 players, 1 of which is the Demon.

name: Sailor
text:
Each night, choose an alive player: 
either you or they are drunk until dusk. 
You can't die.

first.text: The Sailor chooses a living player. (*)

other.text: The Sailor chooses a living player. (*)

name: Saint
text:
If you die by execution, 
your team loses.

name: Savant
text:
Each day, you may visit the Storyteller 
to learn two things in private: 
1 is true & 1 is false.

name: Scapegoat
text: If a player of your alignment is executed, you might be executed instead.

name: Scarlet Woman
text:
If there are 5 or more players alive 
& the Demon dies, you become the Demon. 
(Travellers don't count)

jinxes.text: If there are two living Al-Hadikhias, the Scarlet Woman Al-Hadikhia becomes the Scarlet Woman again.
If the Fang Gu chooses an Outsider and dies, the Scarlet Woman does not become the Fang Gu.

other.text: If the Scarlet Woman became the Demon today, show them the **YOU ARE** token, then the Demon token.

name: Seamstress
text:
Once per game, at night, 
choose 2 players (not yourself): 
you learn if they are the same alignment.

first.text: The Seamstress might choose 2 players. Nod or shake your head. (*)

other.text: The Seamstress might choose 2 players. Nod or shake your head. (*)

name: Sentinel
text: There might be 1 extra or 1 fewer Outsider in play.

name: Shabaloth
text:
Each night*, choose 2 players: they die. 
A dead player you chose last night might be 
regurgitated.

name: Shugenja
text:
You start knowing if your closest evil player 
is clockwise or anti-clockwise. 
If equidistant, this info is arbitrary.

first.text:
Point your finger horizontally in the direction of the closest evil player.
If the two closest evil players are equidistant, point your finger horizontally in either direction.

name: Slayer
text:
Once per game, during the day, 
publicly choose a player: 
if they are the Demon, they die.

name: Snake Charmer
text:
Each night, choose an alive player: 
a chosen Demon swaps characters & alignments 
with you & is then poisoned.

first.text:
The Snake Charmer chooses a player. If they chose the Demon:
    Show the **YOU ARE** & Demon tokens. Give a thumbs down. Swap the Snake Charmer & Demon tokens. 
    Put the old Snake Charmer to sleep. Wake the old Demon.
    Show the **YOU ARE** and Snake Charmer tokens & give a thumbs up. (*)

other.text:
The Snake Charmer chooses a player. If they chose the Demon:
    Show the **YOU ARE** & Demon tokens. Give a thumbs down. Swap the Snake Charmer & Demon tokens. 
    Put the old Snake Charmer to sleep. Wake the old Demon.
    Show the **YOU ARE** and Snake Charmer tokens & give a thumbs up. (*)

name: Snitch
text:
Each Minion 
gets 3 bluffs.

first.text:
Repeat the following process for each Minion:
     Show the THESE CHARACTERS ARE NOT IN PLAY token. Show 3 not-in-play good character tokens.

name: Soldier
text:
You are safe 
from the Demon.

name: Spirit of Ivory
text: There can't be more than 1 extra evil player.

name: Spy
text:
Each night, you see the Grimoire. 
You might register as good 
& as a Townsfolk or Outsider, even if dead.

jinxes.text: When the Spy sees the Grimoire, the Demon and Magician's character tokens are removed.
When the Spy sees the Grimoire, the Demon and Magician's character tokens are removed.
If the Poppy Grower is in play, the Spy does not see the Grimoire until the Poppy Grower dies.
If the Spy is (or has been) in play, the Damsel is poisoned.
The Spy registers as evil to the Ogre.

first.text: Show the Grimoire to the Spy for as long as they need.

other.text: Show the Grimoire to the Spy for as long as they need.

name: Steward
text:
You start knowing 
1 good player.

first.text: Point to the player marked **KNOW**. (*)

name: Storm Catcher
text: Name a good character. If in play, they can only die by execution, but evil players learn which player it is.

name: Summoner
text:
You get 3 bluffs. 
On the 3rd night, choose a player: 
they become an evil Demon of your choice. [No Demon]

jinxes.text: If the Engineer removes a Summoner from play before that Summoner uses their ability, the Summoner uses their ability immediately.
If the Summoner is drunk on the 3rd night, the Summoner chooses which Demon, but the Storyteller chooses which player.

If there is an Alchemist-Summoner in play, the game starts with a Demon in play, as normal. If the Alchemist-Summoner chooses a player, they make that player a Demon but do not change their alignment.
The Marionette neighbors the Summoner. The Summoner knows who the Marionette is.
If the Poppy Grower is alive when the Summoner acts, the Summoner chooses which Demon, but the Storyteller chooses which player.
If the Summoner is in play, the Clockmaker does not receive their information until a Demon is created.
If the Preacher chose the Summoner on or before the 3rd night, the Summoner chooses which Demon, but the Storyteller chooses which player.
The Summoner cannot create an in-play Demon. If the Summoner creates a not-in-play Demon, deaths tonight are arbitrary.
If the Summoner turns a dead player into the Zombuul, the Storyteller treats that player as a Zombuul that has died once.
If the Summoner creates a Lord of Typhon, the Lord of Typhon must neighbor a Minion. The other neighbor becomes a not-in-play evil Minion.
The Summoner cannot create an in-play Demon. If the Summoner creates a not-in-play Demon, deaths tonight are arbitrary.
The Summoner may choose a player to become the Pukka on the 2nd night.
If the Summoner creates Legion, most players (including all evil players) become evil Legion.
The Summoner cannot create an in-play Demon. If the Summoner creates a not-in-play Demon, deaths tonight are arbitrary.

first.text: Remove the Demon and add a Townsfolk.

Place the **NIGHT 1** reminder. (*)
Show the Summoner 3 not-in-play characters as bluffs.

other.text:
On the third night, wake the Summoner:
    They point at a player, and to a Demon icon on the character sheet. Put the Summoner to sleep.
    Wake the chosen player. Show the **YOU ARE** info token, then the Demon token. 
    Show the **YOU ARE** info token, then give a thumbs down. 
    Replace their character token with the Demon token and put the new Demon to sleep.

On night two, place the **NIGHT 2** reminder. (*)
On night three, place the **NIGHT 3** reminder. (*)

name: Sweetheart
text:
When you die, 
1 player is drunk from now on.

other.text: If the Sweetheart died, a player became drunk immediately. fI you haven't done this yet, do so now. (*)

name: Tea Lady
text:
If both your alive neighbors are good, 
they can't die.

name: Thief
text: Each night, choose a player (not yourself): their vote counts negatively tomorrow.

name: Tinker
text:
You might die 
at any time.

other.text: The Tinker might die. (*)

name: Town Crier
text:
Each night*, you learn 
if a Minion nominated today.

other.text: Either nod or shake your head.

name: Toymaker
text: The Demon may choose not to attack & must do this at least once per game. Evil players get normal starting info.

name: Undertaker
text:
Each night*, you learn which character 
died by execution today.

other.text: If a player was executed today, show their character token.

name: Vigormortis
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
Minions you kill keep their ability & poison 1 
Townsfolk neighbor. [-1 Outsider]

other.text: The Vigormortis chooses a player. (*) If that player is a Minion, poison a neighboring Townsfolk. (*)(*)

name: Village Idiot
text:
Each night, choose a player: 
you learn their alignment. 
[+0 to +2 Village Idiots. 1 of the extras is drunk]

first.text:
Wake any Village Idiot, they chooses a player. Give a thumbs up or a thumbs down.
Put that Village Idiot to sleep. Repeat until all Village Idiots have acted.

other.text:
Wake any Village Idiot, they chooses a player. Give a thumbs up or a thumbs down.
Put that Village Idiot to sleep. Repeat until all Village Idiots have acted.

name: Virgin
Vizier
text:
All players know who you are. 
You can not die during the day. 
If good voted, you may choose to execute immediately.

jinxes.text: If the Vizier loses their ability, they learn this. If the Vizier is executed while they have their ability, their team wins.
If the Investigator learns that the Vizier is in play, the existence of the Vizier is not announced by the Storyteller.
If the Vizier and Magician are both in play, the Demon does not learn the Minions.
The Zealot might register as evil to the Vizier.
If the Vizier loses their ability, they learn this. If the Vizier is executed while they have their ability, their team wins.
If the Vizier is in play, the Alsaahir must also guess which Demon(s) are in play.
The Vizier wakes with the Fearmonger, learns who they choose and cannot choose to immediately execute that player.
The Politician might register as evil to the Vizier.

first.text: Declare that the Vizier is in play, and which player it is.

name: Vortox
text:
Each night*, choose a player: they die. 
Townsfolk abilities yield false info. 
Each day, if no-one is executed, evil wins.

jinxes.text: If the Vortox is in play and the Demon kills the Banshee, the players still learn that the Banshee has died.

other.text: The Vortox chooses a player. (*)

name: Voudon
text: Only you & the dead can vote. They don't need a vote token to do so. A 50% majority isn't required.

name: Washerwoman
text:
You start knowing that 1 of 2 players 
is a particular Townsfolk.

first.text: Show the Townsfolk character token. Point to both the **TOWNSFOLK** and **WRONG** players.

name: Widow
text:
On your 1st night, look at the Grimoire 
& choose a player: they are poisoned. 
1 good player knows a Widow is in play.

jinxes.text: When the Widow sees the Grimoire, the Demon and Magician's character tokens are removed.
If the Alchemist has the Widow ability, they do not see the Grimoire.
If the Widow is (or has been) in play, the Damsel is poisoned.
If the Poppy Grower is in play, the Widow does not see the Grimoire until the Poppy Grower dies.

first.text:
Show the Grimoire for as long as the Widow needs.
The Widow picks a player. Mark that player with a **POISONED** reminder. (*) Put the Widow to sleep.
Wake any good player. Show them the Widow token. Put them to sleep. Mark them with the **KNOWS** reminder. (*)

name: Witch
text:
Each night, choose a player: 
if they nominate tomorrow, they die. 
If just 3 players live, you lose this ability.

first.text: The Witch chooses a player. (*)

other.text: The Witch chooses a player. (*)

name: Wizard
text:
Once per game, choose to make a wish. 
If granted, it might have a price & 
leave a clue as to its nature.

name: Xaan
text:
On night X, 
all Townsfolk are poisoned until dusk. 
[X Outsiders]

first.text:
Add the **NIGHT** reminder token that matches the current night. (*)
On the night that equals the number of Outsiders in play when the game began: 
    Add the **X** reminder to the Grimoire. (*) Remove it the following dusk.

other.text:
Add the **NIGHT** reminder token that matches the current night. (*)
On the night that equals the number of Outsiders in play when the game began: 
    Add the **X** reminder to the Grimoire. (*) Remove it the following dusk.

name: Yaggababble
text: You start knowing a secret phrase. For each time you said it publicly today, a player might die.

jinxes.text: If the Exorcist chooses the Yaggababble, the Yaggababble ability does not kill tonight.

first.text:
Write a phrase down so that the Yaggababble can read it.
Show the Yaggababble the phrase.

other.text:
For each time the Yaggababble publicly said their phrase:
    You may place a **DEAD** token next to a living player. (*)

name: Zealot
text:
If 5 or more players are alive, 
you must vote for every nomination.

name: Zombuul
text:
Each night*, if no-one died today, 
choose a player: they die. 
The 1st time you die, you live but register as dead.

other.text: If no one died today, the Zombuul chooses a player. (*)
